There is one summary for S.981. Bill summaries are authored by CRS.
This bill establishes and funds the Medicare Exchange health plan, which
allows individuals who are not otherwise eligible for Medicare to enroll
in a government-administered health insurance plan. The Centers for
Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) must offer such plan in certain
individual health insurance exchanges beginning plan year 2021 and offer
it in all individual health insurance exchanges beginning plan year 2024.
CMS must offer the plan in the small group market in all geographic areas
The plan must meet the same requirements, including essential health
benefits, as existing health insurance exchange plans.
